item.title: Let's Encrypt SSL Certificates for Proxmox VE Using Linode DNS
item.description: If you’re a fan of Proxmox Virtualization Environment (PVE) like I am, you’ll also likely be a fan of the fact that your Proxmox VE server(s) can utilize a free service called Let’s Encrypt to acquire a valid SSL certificate. Let’s Encrypt works by first making you verify ownership of a domain or server, typically using either an HTTP connection to the server, or through a specific DNS record lookup. Once you’ve proven ownership, a certificate is automatically generated and downloaded (and optionally auto-installed on the server) to provide a “valid” TLS connection between your web browser and the server.
